w:r.w:t: The teacher will teach who works at a school by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases:
teacher, principal, cook, nurse, librarian, janitor, A teacher teaches, A principal leads, A cook cooks, A nurse takes care of people, A librarian finds books, A janitor cleans.
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words for people who work at school
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use sets of words in complete sentences
Word List: teacher, principal, cook, nurse, librarian, janitor
This slide will always be the Naativ-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: “Today, we are going to be learning about people at school!
Look at the pictures of the people who work at a school
Read the screen to the child. Circle each person as you say their name. Then circle the school. Tell the child that these people work at the school.
Circle the picture of the teacher and say,
. Write A-B-C in the white space. This will be the action for
Circle the picture of the cook and say,
. Pretend to mix a bowl like the cook in the picture. Have the child repeat.
Circle the picture of the nurse and say,
. Pretend to check your own temperature by putting a hand to your forehead like the nurse in the picture. Have the child repeat.
Draw a line from the action to the person who does the action
Say the name of each worker with their action
Using the drawing tool on the screen, begin to draw a line from the bowl to the cook. Encourage the child to finish the rest independently.
Circle one of the school workers at random. Put your hand to your ear and encourage the student to say the name of the worker and do the action for that worker.
Circle the picture of the janitor and say,
. Pretend to sweep as the action for the janitor. Have the child repeat.
Circle the picture of the librarian and say,
. Pretend to read a book as the action for librarian. Have the child repeat.
Circle the picture of the principal and say,
. Pretend to shake your finger in a disapproving way as the action for the principal. Have the child repeat.
Do all the actions for the people who work at a school
Circle one picture at a time. Encourage the child to do the action for each picture and say the name of the school worker.
Circle the bold word and the picture that matches.
Circle the bold word and the pictures of ABC. Have the child repeat the phrase.
Circle the bold word and draw a line to the ABC picture. Say,
Circle the bold word and the picture that matches.
Circle the bold word and the picture of the man cooking on the stove. Have the child repeat the phrase.
Circle the bold word and draw a line to the stove Say,
A nurse takes care of people
Circle the bold word and the picture that matches.
A nurse takes care of people.
Circle the bold word and the picture of the nurse holding her hand on the child’s forehead. Have the child repeat the phrase.
Circle the bold word and draw a line to the hand on the child’s head. Say,
Circle the bold word and the picture that matches.
Circle the bold word and the picture of the broom. Have the child repeat the phrase.
Circle the bold word and draw a line to the broom. Say,
Circle the bold word and the picture that matches.
Circle the bold word and the picture of the books. Have the child repeat the phrase.
Circle the bold word and draw a line to the books. Say,
Circle the bold word and the picture that matches.
Circle the bold word and the picture of the principal. Have the child repeat the phrase.
Circle the bold word and draw a line to the principal. Say,
Write the missing action for each school worker.
Start read the first sentence. Pause at the blank. Encourage the child to say the answer. Help and prompt the student as necessary. Have the child complete the other two sentences.
Write the missing action for each school worker.
Start read the first sentence. Pause at the blank. Encourage the child to say the answer. Help and prompt the student as necessary. Have the child complete the other two sentences.
Encourage the child to find school workers in the picture.
Ask the child, “Who do you see?” while gesturing to your eyes. Encourage them to find and name the workers in the picture.
Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide
Students should have a blank slide to draw a picture of
teacher, principal, cook, nurse, librarian, janitor
teacher, principal, cook, nurse, librarian, janitor)
Teacher will prompt student to draw a picture to represent
teacher, principal, cook, nurse, librarian, janitor
through pictures. One prompt at a time.
Teacher will write words from the lesson (
teacher, principal, cook, nurse, librarian, janitor)
Word Wall Vocabulary Builder Activity – Slide 22
Students will read and spell their new words:
eacher, principal, cook, nurse, librarian, janitor
Teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
